name: Fake Simplify GST rates to two rates

steps.not_started: There are currently five rates under the Goods and Services Tax
steps.incomplete:
* Reduced to 4 rates
* Reduced to 3 rates

name: Fake Allow more than 50% foreign investment in insurance

steps.not_started: Only 49% foreign investment is currently allowed, with minority ownership for the foreign firm
steps.incomplete: If amendments to Insurance Act are passed by Parliament that more than 50%, but minority ownership regulations are not lifted
steps.completed: Amendments to Insurance Act passed by Parliament allowing majority foreign ownership without management and control restrictions

name: Fake Institute a Mandatory 30-day "Notice and Comment" period for proposed regulations

steps.not_started: Regulations are implemented without a 30-day notice and comment period
steps.incomplete: Ministry of Law and Justice or Cabinet issues note calling on government agencies to honor a 30-day notification period
steps.completed: Parliament passes statutes amending the laws governing India’s financial regulators, mandating a 30-day notice and comment period for proposed regulation

name: Fake Create a bankruptcy resolution process for financial firms

steps.not_started: Financial institutions have been kept out of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code's purview
steps.incomplete: 5/20/2019: A financial resolution bill is approved by Parliament, but underlying regulations are not issued or contain critical weaknesses
steps.completed: 5/5/2020: The law is passed in Parliament and signed into law by the President of India, and related regulations are issued5

name: Fake Stop forcing banks to lend to "priority sectors"

steps.not_started: The Reserve Bank of India currently forces bank to allocate 40% of their credit to priority sectors
steps.incomplete: 5/15/2020: The RBI reduces the stipulation to below 40%, but stops short of abolishing the practice entirely, or allows more flexibility in the discharge of these obligations
steps.completed: The RBI removes its stipulation that banks should allocate a certain percentage to priority sectors.
